body:
Sure, will do.

I was planning to anyway setup a separate tap (if nobody else does it) so we can have the mount command even once they remove support for FUSE since we will get too many issues otherwise about the missing mount command.

Once I do send the PR, we will have the binary not supporting the mount command. How do you want to handle that? Perhaps a separate build tag which can be used in Homebrew that prints out a message (on using mount) regarding the lack of mount support and to download the binary from the website if they want it?

It's not up to me but I think the right thing to do is remove the depends
and the depreciated and then add something in the `caveats` stanza that
mentions that mount won't work without fuse and leave it up to the user to
decide how they want to handle.

On Mon, Nov 16, 2020 at 12:00 PM Anagh Kumar Baranwal <
notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Once I do send the PR, we will have the binary not supporting the mount
> command. How do you want to handle that? Perhaps a separate build tag which
> can be used in Homebrew that prints out a message (on using mount)
> regarding the lack of mount support and to download the binary from the
> website if they want it?
>
> ‚Äî

> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4775#issuecomment-728192064>, or
> unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AADBKD73MMJN2FQIPQQ433DSQFLDHANCNFSM4TWN6ICQ>
> .
>

> Once I do send the PR, we will have the binary not supporting the mount command. How do you want to handle that? Perhaps a separate build tag which can be used in Homebrew that prints out a message (on using mount) regarding the lack of mount support and to download the binary from the website if they want it?

That is a nice idea. So a `brew` build tag maybe?
Yep, will send a PR in the next few days if that's fine?

issue.title: cmount: Add optional `brew` tag

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
cmount: Add optional `brew` tag to throw an error when using mount in the binaries installed via Homebrew - Fixes #4775

body: Seems like maybe I jumped the gun on this after reading the the comments on the depreciation. I think just updating the formula to remove the fuse dependency for build is the right way to go. No reason to keep the prebuilt binaries from using fuse if it's available. Still might be worth mentioning it in `caveats`.

issue.title: Question: cask version of rclone (and other deprecated/limited formulae)

repository.name: homebrew-cask
repository.description: üçª A CLI workflow for the administration of macOS applications distributed as binaries

issue.body:
In the wake of PR https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-core/pull/64491, which deprecated formulae that rely on FUSE because it is an external dependency that went closed-source, `rclone` does not include support for mounting drives (which is the part that relies on FUSE) when installed from the formula, even when FUSE is manually installed as an external dependency (see https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4775).

I made a cask version of `rclone` that downloads fully featured binaries from the project's GitHub releases page and also includes the `macfuse` cask as a dependency: https://github.com/brettferdosi/homebrew-tap/blob/main/Casks/rclone-cask.rb. I am making this issue so that others who might find this useful can see it, and I am also wondering whether the main cask tap might accept this kind of cask.

issue.title: Homebrew cask for fully featured rclone

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
The current Homebrew formula for `rclone` builds a version of the binary that doesn't support mounting, even when `macfuse` is installed independently (https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/4775). I've created a Homebrew cask that downloads and installs a fully featured version of `rclone` from the project's GitHub releases page (and includes the `macfuse` cask as a dependency). I'm making an issue here so other Homebrew users who want to have a scriptable, fully-featured rclone install can know about it.

The cask is here: https://github.com/brettferdosi/homebrew-tap/blob/main/Casks/rclone-cask.rb - feel free to use it directly (though no guarantees about timely updates) or copy it into your own tap. I asked about getting this included in the main Homebrew cask tap but the response was negative: https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew-cask/issues/106519.
